page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area includes many farms. Hardings,Groves,Crumps and Actons being but a few. Most of the area is High Wych which used to be part of Sawbridgeworth Parish (the name 'High Wych means High Woodland). At the time of the Domesday book Sawbridgeworth was held by Geoffrey de Mandeville. Sawbridgeworth was inherited by the de Sayes in 1186 (Sayes Park Farm being all that remains of their estate).The town of Sawbridgeworth is only partially included in the area.Sawbridgeworth is on the A1184 from London to Cambridge.Most of the area is farmland but some of it is being built on by developers like the White Post Field/Highgate Grove development.
